Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have things been since we last met?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been okay. I actually updated my resume like I said I would.
That’s fantastic! How did that feel?
It felt good to finally do it. I was putting it off for a while.
I’m glad you took that step. Have you had a chance to look for job openings yet?
Yes, I found a couple of positions I’m interested in.
That’s wonderful! What kind of roles are you looking at?
I’m looking at nursing positions in a couple of hospitals and clinics nearby.
That sounds promising! Have you thought about how you’ll approach applying?
I think I’ll just send out a few applications and see what happens.
That’s a solid plan! Remember to tailor your cover letter to each position. It can make a big difference.
I’ll keep that in mind. I’m a bit nervous about interviews, though.
That’s completely normal! Would you like to practice some interview questions together?
Yes, that would help.
Great! Let’s start with a common question: “Tell me about yourself.”
Okay, um… I’m a recent nursing graduate, and I’ve always wanted to help people. I have experience in customer service, which has helped me develop my communication skills.
That’s a good start! You might want to add a bit about what you’re looking for in a nursing role.
Right! I’m looking for a position where I can continue to learn and grow in a supportive environment.
Perfect! That shows your desire for professional development. Let’s try another question: “What are your strengths?”
I think my strengths are being empathetic and patient. I’ve always been good at listening to others.
Those are excellent strengths for a nurse! How about challenges? Can you think of a weakness you’d like to share?
I guess I can be a bit shy when meeting new people.
That’s honest. You could also mention how you’re working on it, like through this therapy.
That’s a good idea. I’ll say I’m trying to improve my confidence in social situations.
Great! Remember, it’s all about showing your willingness to grow. How are you feeling about these potential interviews now?
I feel a bit more confident, actually. Practicing helps.
I’m glad to hear that! How about your relaxation techniques? Have you been able to use them?
Yes, I tried the muscle relaxation technique before bed, and it helped me sleep better.
That’s wonderful progress! Sleep is so crucial for your overall well-being. Have you noticed any changes in your mood since you’ve been sleeping better?
I think I’ve been less irritable at work. I feel more focused.
That’s fantastic to hear! It sounds like you’re making positive strides. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I’ve been thinking about my family a lot. They keep asking me about my job search.
It’s great that they’re supportive. How does that make you feel?
It makes me feel a bit pressured, but I know they mean well.
It’s understandable to feel that way. Perhaps you could set boundaries by letting them know when you have updates instead of feeling pressured to share constantly.
That sounds like a good idea. I’ll talk to them about it.
Excellent! Communication is key. Lastly, how are you feeling about the potential job opportunities?
I feel excited but also a bit anxious about the interviews.
That’s completely normal. Remember to take it one step at a time. You’ve prepared well, and you’re capable of handling whatever comes your way.
Thank you, Ellie. I really appreciate your support.
You’re doing great! Let’s wrap up for today. Keep practicing those techniques and stay positive about your job search.
I will! See you next time!
Bye! Take care!
Bye!
